v.v: I give praise to Yahweh with all my life,
You cover yourself with light as with a garment;
You lay the beams of your chambers on the clouds;
He makes the winds his messengers,
He laid the foundations of the earth,
You covered the earth with water like a garment;
Your rebuke made the waters recede;
The mountains rose, and the valleys spread out
You have set a boundary for them that they will not cross;
He made springs flow into the valleys;
They supply water for all the animals of the field;
By the riverbanks the birds build their nests;
He waters the mountains from his water chambers in the sky.
He makes the grass grow for the cattle
He makes wine to make man happy,
The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain;
There the birds make their nests.
The wild goats live on the high mountains;
He appointed the moon to mark the seasons;
You make the darkness of the night
The young lions roar for their prey
When the sun rises, they retreat
Meanwhile, people go out to their work
Yahweh, how many and varied are your works!
Over there is the sea, deep and wide,
The ships travel there,
All these look to you to give them
When you give to them, they gather;
When you hide your face, they are troubled;
When you send out your Spirit, they are created,
May the glory of Yahweh last forever;
He looks down on the earth, and it shakes;
I will sing to Yahweh all my life;
May my thoughts be sweet to him;
May sinners vanish from the earth,

v: Yahweh my God, you are very magnificent;
you are clothed with splendor and majesty.
you spread out the heavens like a tent curtain.
you make the clouds your chariot;
you walk on the wings of the wind.
flames of fire his servants.
and it will never be moved.
the water covered the mountains.
at the sound of your thunderous voice they fled.
into the places that you had appointed for them.
they will not cover the earth again.
the streams flow between the mountains.
the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
they sing among the branches.
The earth is filled with the fruit of his labor.
and plants for man to cultivate
so that man may produce food from the earth.
oil to make his face shine,
and food to sustain his life.
the cedars of Lebanon which he planted.
The stork makes the cypress tree her home.
the mountain heights are a refuge for the hyraxes.
the sun knows its time for setting.
when all the beasts of the forest come out.
and seek their food from God.
and sleep in their dens.
and labor away until the evening.
With wisdom you made them all;
the earth overflows with your works.
teeming with innumerable creatures,
both small and great.
and Leviathan is also there, which you formed to play in the sea.
their food on time.
when you open your hand, they are satisfied.
if you take away their breath, they die
and return to dust.
and you renew the countryside.
may Yahweh enjoy his creation.
he touches the mountains, and they smoke.
I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
I will rejoice in Yahweh.
and let the wicked be no more.
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life.
Praise Yahweh.
